snippet: Vesta, the second-largest asteroid in our solar system, has planetlike features but fails the gravitational bully test for full status, says a report in Friday’s issue of the journal Science.
abstract: Observation's by NASA's Dawn spacecraft published in journal Science confirm that Vesta, the solar system's second largest asteroid, is in fact a dwarf planet.
lead_paragraph: Vesta, the second-largest asteroid in our solar system, has planetlike features but fails the gravitational bully test for full status, says a report in Friday’s issue of the journal Science.

headline.seo: Asteroid Vesta Provides Hints of How Earth Came Together
headline.main: Observations of an Asteroid Provide Hints of How the Earth Came Together
headline.print_headline: Observations of an Asteroid Provide Hints of How the Earth Came Together
